JD-Xi Editor
  • API Reference
  • jdxi_editor
  • jdxi_editor.midi
  • jdxi_editor.midi.data
  • jdxi_editor.midi.data.parameter
  • jdxi_editor.midi.data.parameter.effects
  • jdxi_editor.midi.data.parameter.effects.effects
  • View page source

jdxi_editor.midi.data.parameter.effects.effects

This module defines the EffectParameter class, which manages effect-related parameters for JD-Xi patch data. It provides functionality to retrieve parameter addresses, convert values between display and MIDI formats, and categorize parameters based on effect types.

Classes

class jdxi_editor.midi.data.parameter.effects.effects.EffectParameter(address: int, min_val: int, max_val: int, display_min: int | None = None, display_max: int | None = None)

Represents an effect parameter with an address, value range, and optional display range.

Methods:

get_display_value() → Tuple[int, int]

Returns the display range for the parameter.

get_address_by_name(name: str) → int | None

Looks up an effect parameter address by its name.

get_by_address(address: int) → EffectParameter | None

Retrieves an effect parameter by its address.

get_by_name(name: str) → EffectParameter | None

Retrieves an effect parameter by its name.

convert_to_midi(display_value: int) → int

Converts a display value to a corresponding MIDI value.

get_midi_value(param_name: str, value: int) → int | None

Returns the MIDI value for an effect parameter given its name and display value.

get_common_param_by_name(name: str) → EffectCommonParameter | None

Categorizes an effect parameter into a common effect type.

Constants

This class defines various constants representing effect parameters, such as:

  • EFX1_TYPE

  • EFX1_LEVEL

  • DELAY_LEVEL

  • REVERB_LEVEL

Each parameter is defined as a tuple containing:

  • Address (int)

  • Minimum value (int)

  • Maximum value (int)

  • Display minimum value (Optional[int])

  • Display maximum value (Optional[int])

Usage Example

param = EffectParameter.get_by_name("EFX1_LEVEL")
if param:
    midi_value = param.convert_to_midi(64)
    print(f"MIDI Value: {midi_value}")

Function Address Value Type Description EFX2 Type 00 00 0–5 or 0–8 Sets effect type (e.g., Thru, Distortion, Fuzz) EFX2 Level 00 01 0–127 Overall effect output EFX2 Delay Send Level 00 02 0–127 Send to Delay effect EFX2 Reverb Send Level 00 03 0–127 Send to Reverb effect EFX2 Parameter 1 00 11 Signed 4-byte int Meaning depends on EFX2 Type EFX2 Parameter 2 00 15 Signed 4-byte int As above … … … Up to Param 32 at 01 0D Example for Distortion (EFX2_TYPE = 01) Param # Address Meaning Param 1 00 11 Drive Param 2 00 15 Presence Param 3 00 19 (possibly unused or Level)

Classes

AddressParameterEffect1

Effect parameters with address and value range

AddressParameterEffect2

Effect parameters with address and value range

AddressParameterDelay

Effect parameters with address and value range

AddressParameterReverb

Effect parameters with address and value range
